title: THREEs a Crowd
body_text:
WALL, ALL in Eight Round
Can WALL Go Three-in-a-row?
A fast, furious confrontation even for the eighth time! The biggest turnout for any
WALL/ALL
contest perhaps produced more intensity and high-impact hits than its predecessors. Just let the score do the talking.
Flash Results by Game
:
ALL: 1, 3
WALL: 2
Players were drenched in pools of their own sweat after this one was all said and done. A plethora of legendary performers came out to maim someone; Megill, Wolf, Krott, Adams, Kerr, Fitzpatrick, Edwards, Londono, DiBuccio, Letsche just to name a few.
ALL 2, WALL 1.
The YEARBOOK
The eight incarnation of Team ALL was a massive 21 combatants: Manasquan
(Kelly, Krott, Londono, McCrorey, Megill, Stopa, J. Yochum)
; Ocean Township
(Edwards, Teitelbaum)
; Pennington
(Auchinleck, D'Luhy)
; Allentown
(DiBuccio)
; Shore Regional
(Spengeman)
; Brick Township
(James)
; St. Rose
(Everett)
; Monmouth Regional
(Tronolone)
; Red Bank Catholic
(D. Fitzpatrick)
; Calvary Academy
(Smalls)
; Monsignor Donovan
(Turner)
; Freehold Boro
(Pham)
; North Mecklenburg [North Carolina]
(M. Yochum)
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Team ALL defeated Team WALL, 2 - 1.
Moments & Stars
: Zach Katz inadvertantly smacking the rim early in Game 1; teammates Diana DiBuccio, Dan Fitzpatrick, and John Tronolone bickering all event long; Mike Edwards's amazing "Last Man Standing" rimshot in Game 4; all those who mocked Ryan Letsche's "Noooo!" yell; the countless double eliminations and deflections catches
Attendance
: 34, comprised of 28 men and 6 women. This was the largest turnout for a
WALL/ALL
match-up.
New Players
: Max Yochum
Familiar Faces
: Tom Adams and Ken James made rare appearances at DODGEBALL 153.
Other Notes
: ALL for the second time, stopped WALL from capturing three consecutive wins. The series stands with WALL at 5 and ALL at 3.
Never, Ever Going to End!
The long-standing
RIVALRY of the Year
'07 has gone an agonizing distance for all those involved. Take a look at it's 14-month history!
WALL Wins:
WALL v. ALL 1
..
WALL v. ALL 2
..
WALL v. ALL 4
..
WALL v. ALL 6
..
WALL v. ALL VII
.
ALL Wins:
WALL v. ALL 3
..
WALL v. ALL 5
.. WALL v. ALL 8
.
COMING UP NEXT ...
body_html:
WALL, ALL in Eight Round
Can WALL Go Three-in-a-row?

A fast, furious confrontation even for the eighth time! The biggest turnout for any WALL/ALL contest perhaps produced more intensity and high-impact hits than its predecessors. Just let the score do the talking.

Flash Results by Game:
ALL: 1, 3
WALL: 2

Players were drenched in pools of their own sweat after this one was all said and done. A plethora of legendary performers came out to maim someone; Megill, Wolf, Krott, Adams, Kerr, Fitzpatrick, Edwards, Londono, DiBuccio, Letsche just to name a few.

ALL 2, WALL 1.

The YEARBOOK
The eight incarnation of Team ALL was a massive 21 combatants: Manasquan (Kelly, Krott, Londono, McCrorey, Megill, Stopa, J. Yochum); Ocean Township (Edwards, Teitelbaum); Pennington (Auchinleck, D'Luhy); Allentown (DiBuccio); Shore Regional (Spengeman); Brick Township (James); St. Rose (Everett); Monmouth Regional (Tronolone); Red Bank Catholic (D. Fitzpatrick); Calvary Academy (Smalls); Monsignor Donovan (Turner); Freehold Boro (Pham); North Mecklenburg [North Carolina] (M. Yochum)

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Team ALL defeated Team WALL, 2 - 1.
Moments & Stars: Zach Katz inadvertantly smacking the rim early in Game 1; teammates Diana DiBuccio, Dan Fitzpatrick, and John Tronolone bickering all event long; Mike Edwards's amazing "Last Man Standing" rimshot in Game 4; all those who mocked Ryan Letsche's "Noooo!" yell; the countless double eliminations and deflections catches
Attendance: 34, comprised of 28 men and 6 women. This was the largest turnout for a WALL/ALL match-up.
New Players: Max Yochum
Familiar Faces: Tom Adams and Ken James made rare appearances at DODGEBALL 153.
Other Notes: ALL for the second time, stopped WALL from capturing three consecutive wins. The series stands with WALL at 5 and ALL at 3.

Never, Ever Going to End!
The long-standing RIVALRY of the Year '07 has gone an agonizing distance for all those involved. Take a look at it's 14-month history!
WALL Wins: WALL v. ALL 1 .. WALL v. ALL 2 .. WALL v. ALL 4 .. WALL v. ALL 6 .. WALL v. ALL VII.
ALL Wins: WALL v. ALL 3 .. WALL v. ALL 5 .. WALL v. ALL 8.



COMING UP NEXT ...
